Package com.cm.projects.spring.resource.chasis.repository

Class SupportRepository<T,​E>

java.lang.Object
com.cm.projects.spring.resource.chasis.repository.SupportRepository<T,​E>
Type Parameters:
T - entity affected by the changes
E - edited entity used to store changes temporarily before approval
public class SupportRepository<T,​E>
extends java.lang.Object
Used to handle update requests (persisting changes in the edited entity, fetching changes, declining changes and updating entity with the changes from edited entity)
Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Cornelius M

    • SupportRepository

  • Method Details

    • handleEditRequest

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> handleEditRequest​(T entity, T oldEntity, java.lang.Class<E> editEntity) throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException, ExpectationFailed
      Checks if changes were made if true it persists changes to entity storage. This method is different from super class since changes don't affect the original entity they are saved in the edit entity first
      Parameters:
      entity - current entity
      oldEntity - previous entity
      editEntity - entity storage
      Returns:
      List of changes or an empty List if changes were not found found
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if it fails to locate Id field
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if it fails to save the current entity to entity storage
      ExpectationFailed - When editEntity param does not have fields annotated;
      • @EditDataWrapper used to store new edited data
      • @EditEntityId used to store the id of the entity being updated
      • @EditEntity used to store name of entity being updated

    • fetchChanges

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> fetchChanges​(T oldBean, T newBean) throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Used to fetch List of changes between two entities. Only fields annotated with ModifiableField are compared For OneToMany field, ModifiableField.name() is used for changes description. For Example
      Primary Class 
            class Role{
              @Id
              private Short id;
              @ModifiableField(name = "Permission")
              @OneToMany
              private List permissions
      }
      Mapper Class 
           class RolePermission{
         @Id
         private Short id;
         @RelEntityLabel(fieldName="permission")
         @ManyToOne
         private Permission permission;
     }
      Child Class 
           class Permission{
         @Id
         private Short id;
         private String permission = "Can Create User";
     }
      Will be "Added permission Can Create User"
      Parameters:
      newBean - updated entity
      oldBean - old entity
      Returns:
      a List of String changes
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if fields with changes are not accessible

    • compareCollection

      public boolean compareCollection​(java.util.Collection<?> col1, java.util.Collection<?> col2)
      Used to compare two collection if their equals
      Parameters:
      col1 - first collection
      col2 - second collection
      Returns:
      true if equals and false if not

    • processCollectionChanges

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> processCollectionChanges​(java.lang.reflect.Field field, java.util.Collection<?> _oldValue, java.util.Collection<?> _newValue)
      Used to process changes
      Parameters:
      field - field with collection entities
      _oldValue - existing value in the database
      _newValue - new value
      Returns:
      List of changes

    • getFieldValue

      public java.lang.Object getFieldValue​(java.lang.Object entity, java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> annotation, boolean useEntityManager)
      Fetch field value from an with the declared annotation
      Parameters:
      entity - target entity/POJO
      annotation - annotation class for example @RelEntityLabel
      useEntityManager - true if value is to be fetched from entity manager
      Returns:
      Object field value or null if it can't locate the value

    • fetchChanges

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> fetchChanges​(java.io.Serializable id, T t) throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException, java.io.IOException
      Used to fetch List of changes
      Parameters:
      id - entity id
      t - the old entity
      Returns:
      a List of String changes
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if fields with changes are not accessible
      java.io.IOException - if changes cannot be mapped back to entity
      See Also:
      fetchChanges(Object, Object)

    • fetchEntity

      public T fetchEntity​(java.io.Serializable id)
      Fetch entity excluding entities in trash
      Parameters:
      id - entity id
      Returns:
      persistent context entity

    • mergeChanges

      public T mergeChanges​(java.io.Serializable id, T t) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Used to merge entity from Storage. Updates new values from edited record to the provided entity
      Parameters:
      t - The old entity cannot be null
      id - Unique key id of this entity
      Returns:
      T new merged changes or the current entity if changes could not be found
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - occurs when changes cannot be mapped back to entity
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - occurs when the field annotated with @ModifiableField is not accessible
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if t is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • getEntityChanges

      public java.util.List<E> getEntityChanges​(java.io.Serializable id)
      Used to check has changes in the temp entity
      Parameters:
      id - entity id
      Returns:
      entity if changes exists
      Throws:
      javax.persistence.NoResultException - if changes were not found

    • clearEntityChanges

      public void clearEntityChanges​(java.io.Serializable id)
      Used to clear all entity changes with the specified entity id
      Parameters:
      id - entity id

    • updateEdit

      public T updateEdit​(T newBean, T oldBean) throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Update entity with changes from the new object
      Parameters:
      oldBean - previous record
      newBean - new record
      Returns:
      updated bean
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - occurs when the field annotated with ModifiableField is not accessible

    • declineChanges

      public void declineChanges​(java.io.Serializable id) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Used to decline entity changes. It clears data from the EditEntity
      Parameters:
      id - entity id
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if modified fields cannot be accessed
